The outcome of the referendum opens an evolution in industrial relations, especially in large factories that should allow a better use of the plants and a real increase in salaries, Maurizio Sacconi told Italian state radio. She went on live television and drank vodka. The actress appeared on the "Late Show With David Letterman ' on Wednesday. David Letterman asked her what Betty White 's hobbies are now. David Letterman asked her, What do you like to do in your free time. She replied, "Oh I like to do most anything, play with animals mostly and uh Vodka is kind of a hobby. And as if the moment couldn"t get any more scripted, David Letterman pulled out two glasses with ice and vodka. Betty White drank out of the cup as David Letterman drank out of the bottle.

The Crown Prosecution Service has also asked a senior QC to "comprehensively" re-examine material amassed as part of the original inquiry and any new evidence. In his resignation statement, Mr Andy Coulson said: Nothing is more important than the Government's task of getting this country back on its feet. "Unfortunately continued coverage of events connected to my old job at the News of the World has made it difficult for me to give the 110% needed in this role. "I stand by what I've said about those events but when the spokesman needs a spokesman it's time to move on. Mr Andy Coulson joined Mr David Cameron 's team before the General Election and then ran the PM's communications strategy. Labour leader Ed Miliband said the row raised "real questions about David Cameron 's judgement

the current spring in Donald Rumsfeld 's step is the resulting abandonment by Barack Obama of much of his strident opposition to President Bush 's anti-terrorism policies. Turning to Dick Cheney at CPAC, Donald Rumsfeld taunted the Left by saying: I look at the current administration's many reversals of their announced policies on national security issues- Guantanamo Bay, military commissions, indefinite detention, CIA drone strikes. "It makes me wonder if Dick Cheney has had more influence on Barack Obama than the people that got him elected. The vociferous anger of the Rand Paul supporters at CPAC indicated that Republicans remain divided over the President Bush legacy. The Paulites, however, are very much in the minority.
